conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the velocity-time graphs of objects A and B to determine when they meet.

premise: Object B's graph starts at a higher velocity and decreases linearly.
conclusion: The area under this graph is a trapezoid, representing the distance traveled by object B over time.
